title: Medieval Society
description: A survey of Medieval civilization featuring such topics as the individual, political institutions, art, architecture, religion, philosophy, literature, social life, and leisure activities.

title: Europe: 410-1303
description: The political, cultural, economic, and ecclesiastical development of Europe from the fall of the Roman Empire to the end of the High Middle Ages.

title: Heresy and Religious Crises in Late Medieval Europe
description: An exploration of the impact of social crises on late medieval religious modes of expression. Topics will include the Great Famine, the Black Death, the Avignon Papacy and Western Schism, the development of heretical movements, and the eventual disintegration of European religious unity. [Note: This course fulfils the Area 2 requirement for Religious Studies majors.]

title: Introduction to Medieval Studies
description: An introduction to Medieval European civilization focusing on essential aspects of the discipline: history, literature, philosophy, religion, art, architecture and archaeology, law, and science and technology.

title: The History of Islamic Civilization from 1300-1800: The Islamic Gunpowder Empires
description: This course studies in comparative fashion the rise, consolidation, and decline of the three major Islamic empires of the early modern period (c. 1300-1800): the Ottomans in Anatolia, the Balkans, and the Middle East; the Safavids in Iran; and the Mughals in India. [Note: SI 121R recommended.]
